item.title: Risk-sensitive Distributional Reinforcement Learning
item.description: What is risk? Generally, risk might arise whenever there is uncertainty. In a financial situation, investment risk can be identified with uncertain monetary loss. In a safety-critical engineering system, risk is the undesirable detrimental outcome. How do we measure risk? Risk metrics typically involve probability distribution of outcomes and quantified loss for each outcome. The standard deviation is a measure of uncertainty, but not a good choice for risk measure.
